channel.title: TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 causes hang?
channel.description:
When I set /etc/environment to TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 I find that when rebooting the Workstation, it hangs on a job not terminating, waiting 1 minute 30 seconds for it to finish.
What is the cause of this? I'm also experiencing other problems, regular websites will not always load pictures not even for buttons, making them hard to navigate.

item.title: TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 causes hang?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
rob75:

when rebooting the Workstation, it hangs on a job not terminating, waiting 1 minute 30 seconds for it to finish.

To debug.

Enable Persistent Systemd Journal Log

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Troubleshooting#Enable_Persistent_Systemd_Journal_Log

Then Check Systemd Journal Log of Previous Boot

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Troubleshooting#Check_Systemd_Journal_Log_of_Previous_Boot

Read full topic

item.title: TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 causes hang?
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
TOR_TRANSPROXY=1 disables all proxy settings in the Tor Browser. It won’t add a 1m 30s delay to shutdowns. It’s likely something else causing the issues.

rob75:

regular websites will not always load pictures not even for buttons, making them hard to navigate.

Are you using the safest security level? It disables SVG images.

Read full topic
